column4: QUESTION: I'm having a problem. The desktop vanished, icons missing, can't right-click desktop. I tried using gconf-editor and setting apps->nautilus->preferences->show_desktop to "true", and it works, but as soon as I log out and back in again it is once again broken. Any ideas? Packages I can reinstall? Help!
nautilus is responsible for your desktop
Yes, I understand.
was it false before you changed it to true?
No, it was always true.
so how do you set it to true...?
I opened the gconf-editor, on a hunch, turned it to false, then BACK to true, and that fixed it temporarily.
upon logging out and back in, however, it was broken again.
create a fresh new user and verify the problem exists there please
Just created a new user. Logging in... No desktop interactivity. Can't right-click, and no icons display.
what ubuntu version?
10.04 -- installed the minimal ISO then did apt-get install ubuntu-desktop to install the remainder of the system -- the system has a dodgy CD drive, and no other ISO images would work.
anything in ~/.xsession-errors?
let me check.
Nothing in .xsession-errors mentioning show_desktop, nautilus, or anything I can immediately relate
polkit, power-manager, compiz (GLXFBConfig), evolution, update-notifier, gnome-terminal
Rebooting -- I just "aptitude reinstall"ed gconf2 and nautilus
System reboted after reinstalling nautilus and gconf2 -- no effect, still having the issue.
does it happen if you don't use compiz?
I'm not using compiz.
keep an eye on https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus/+bug/573947
Thanks for the link. I'll submit my information as well. Problem is, this is a family computer, I'm only visiting for a week. By the time this gets fixed, I'll likely be out of the state.
see if you can workaround it by running gconftool on startup
